<<<<<<< HEAD
A true divrnall: or A continued relation of Irish occurences, from the 12. of Febr. to the 8. of March. Printed after a copy that was sent from Mr. William Bladen of Dublin, to his sonne resident here in London: shewing what overthrowes was given to the rebells, and what good successe the Protestant party had; with a relation of the late reliefe of Trohedagh. Bladen, W. (William)
[6] p.
for William Bladen, and are to be sold by Francis Couls ..., Printed at London : 1642.
Signed at end: William Bladen and dated Dublin: March. 8 1641. Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland.
=======

Printed after a copy that was sent from Mr. William Bladen of Dublin, to his sonne resident here in London: shewing what overthrowes was given to the rebells, and what good successe the Protestant party had; with a relation of the late reliefe of Trohedagh. Bladen, W. (William)
[6] p.
for William Bladen, and are to be sold by Francis Couls ..., Printed at London : 1642.
Signed at end: William Bladen and dated Dublin: March. 8 1641. Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland.
Francis Couls
